dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE WIDEN OUT and see Stevie riding his bike through the P area of Los Angeles. He has his headphones on and a mid 9 Hip Sop song plays. He is wearing an oversized white T-sh and baggy jeans. He gently nods his head to the song. We pass by liquor stores, auto body shops, taco trucks, a store called ULTIMATE that hasn’t yet opened for the day. He continues to nod his head and ride his bike when ALL O THE SUDDEN the song starts skipping on one of the song’s lyrics. It keeps repeating as Stevie pulls over and stops bike. He pulls out a beat up DISCMAN and handles it with extreme care like a priceless jewel. He is freaked out something is wrong with it. CLOSE ON DISCMAN as he shakes and hits the "play/pause" button rapidly. We hear breathi and the noise of the CD reloading and then ALL OF THE SUD the song kicks back in where it left off and Stevie is ri again, nodding his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevie rides up to PALMS MIDDLE SCHOOL. He locks up his b against a chain link fence. EXT. STAIRWELL —- LUNCH Stevie sits with his two friends, RANDON, 13 (an obese wh kid) & CHRIS, 13 (rail thin white kid with braces).  Revision 3. They sit in the stairwell. Stevie uses his shirt to clean Discman thoroughly. Randon and Chris playing with POGS, little circular paper discs that you stack up and hit wit metal "Slammer". The Pogs that turn over are kept by the person who threw down the "Slammer".

dialogues.speaker: YESSSSSSSS
dialogues.text: Randon gathers up all of his new pogs.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Fuckin' motherfuckin' cunt-pussy.

dialogues.speaker: RANDON
dialogues.text: And the “special edition green pounder” slammer! Chris reluctantly hands the slammer to Randon.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: That's my favorite fucking slammer! Fuck! I need a do-over.

dialogues.speaker: RANDON
dialogues.text: No do-over’s! (smiling proudly) You’1l have a chance to win it back tonight. Chris stared daggers at Randon. Randon realizes he said something he shouldn’t have. Stevie thinks for a second.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Oh, are you guys hanging out tonight? Randon and Chris share an uncomfortable look.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Yeah... Randon is gonna sleep at my house. You’re welcome to come hang out for a while.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (sensing something is weird) Okay...

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: It’s just... my mom said I could only have one friend sleep over. Or Whatever.  Stevie takes this in. This clearly hurts him very much.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Oh. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I wish there was something I could do.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (this is hard to ask/almost pathetic) Could you, like, ask her again maybe? Like, if that’s not weird? Chris doesn’t know what to say. It’s uncomfortable. Chris Stevie uncomfortably avoid eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (very left out) Well...

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Randon and I had already talked about it, like, Monday or whatever. Stevie is quiet. Hurt.

dialogues.speaker: RANDON
dialogues.text: (very well intentioned) You should still come and hang out and play Pogs.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, and then just go home when it’s time to go to sleep or whatever? Stevie is hurt and can’t figure out what to say. silence.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (changing subject) It’s your turn. Stevie stands up and begins to walk away. Beat of  Revision 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevie unlocks his bike. He breathes in five times deeply grabs the chain link fence with both hands, doubles over RAMS the top of his head into it like a bull. He SMUSHES top of his head and part of his face as hard as he can in the fence until he can’t take it anymore. He removes his but keeps his hands interlocked on the fence. He smushes head until he exhausts himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevie rides his bike down the street, listening to his Discman, the batteries die and the song abruptly stops. H stops his bike to see if he can fix the music situation. hears the sounds of skateboard wheels rolling on concrete wood slapping on concrete and laughter and shit talking o teenagers. He turns to see what he is hearing. From across the street outside of the Ultimate skate shop Stevie sees RUBEN ALVAREZ (13, skinny Mexican kid), FUCKS (17, skinny black kid with a shaved head), FOURTH GRADE ( white kid with long hair and a flannel), JORGE SILVA, (18 handsome Mexican kid who looks like a real athlete), skat outside the shop. There is a boom box playing hip hop mus Ruben is on the ground with a bar of wax, waxing up the c The others are doing flip tricks and ollies and 180’s on sidewalk out front of the shop. The curb is done being wa and the skaters start riding up and grinding and doing bo slides on the waxed up curb. Some fall HARD onto the stre while others narrowly avoid being hit by cars. They are cracking jokes and laughing at each other’s expense the w time lovingly. Fourth Grade films them doing their tricks Stevie watches this whole scene go down. CLOSE ON STEVIE’S FACE WATCHING. CLOSE ON CIGARETTES BEING LIT BY SKATERS. CLOSE ON STEVIE'S EYES. Jorge lands a perfect nose blunt on the curb and lands perfectly. The crew of skaters goes nuts celebrating and slapping their boards on the ground. SLOW MOTION SHOT of the crew running up to him and celebrating his victory. Rubbing of his hair and bro-hugs continue in the slow motion celebration. Fuckshit shakes head like “that was dope” and can’t not give Jorge a poun Jorge tries to look at the playback. Fourth Grade whips t camera away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuh uh. No peeking. No one sees anything ‘til the whole thing is done.

dialogues.speaker: JORGE
dialogues.text: Come on! Stevie clocks this respect and affection between them.

dialogues.speaker: FUCKSHIT
dialogues.text: (regarding Jorge) Don’t worry, you don’t wanna see that sloppy shit anyway, nigga.

dialogues.speaker: JORGE
dialogues.text: Ha! You WISH you were landing that! Ruben laughs.

dialogues.speaker: FUCKSHIT
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you’re laughing at? I only see you landing kickflips with one foot like a bitch! The crew laughs.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) I land ‘em on carpet every time. The crew lets out a “come on” noise.

dialogues.speaker: FUCKSHIT
dialogues.text: Maybe we can have the city pave all the sidewalks with carpet for you, nigga! The crew all laughs. Ruben is used to this treatment.

dialogues.speaker: FUCKSHIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go back in the store and unpack the boxes of hoodies. Fuckshit playfully pushes Ruben into the store. Ruben run to do what is asked of him. The crew pays and leaves the store. SLOW MOTION of Stevie watching this. His face is filled w an almost smile.  7. The sounds of the skaters’ joy fades out as the sound of clinking of silverware against plates fades up.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You're eating too fast. INT. STEVIE’S HOUSE - DINNER TABLE - EVENING Stevie and Dabney are mid conversation. There is a third place setting with untouched food and a vacant chair.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: (without even thinking) You look sloppier than you are when you do that. Stevie feels shame. He puts his silverware down and sits straighter. Beat. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I haven’t called that guy Todd back. Stevie looks up. She needs him to listen.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: He’s nice and everything but I feel like a third date says A LOT.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Do you think you may like him?

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: He’s fine. He’s nice. I’m attracted to him and all. It’s just... I don’t know. I don’t have a lot of time as it is. And I like to spend that time with you. Stevie smiles and looks down. Neither of them realize the oddness of this dynamic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You’re the only person I don’t get sick of. They both giggle a little. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How was school?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable/distraught sigh) I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Randon And Chris are having a sleepover or whatever.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: (quickly/guilt provoking) Oh and you want to have a sleepover with them? I wouldn’t have cooked if that is what you wanted to do... So that’s what you want to do? (with guilt) That’s fine. Fine.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (stopping her) No. No. Chris’ mom said only one of them could sleep over and I guess Chris chose Randon or whatever. Dabney slams her fork down.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT
dialogues.text: Stevie looks down.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have had that little shit, no offense, over here so many times, How dare she make you feel that way?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: It’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweetly to Stevie) It is fine. You know why? Because you and I are going to have so much more fun here than... Randon and Chris are going to have. It’s a good thing if you think about it, because we get to have an amazing night together. Stevie wants to say more about how this hurt him but, he swallows it. He eats more of his food quickly.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Slow down. Dabney puts his fork down and looks into Stevie’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You get to watch whatever you want tonight. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (hiding pain) Yeah. We’ll have more fun together. She puts her hand on Stevie’s face.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: (sincere) You don’t deserve to feel shitty. Stevie looks down and smiles with his face still in the p of her hand. Ian enters and breaks up this moment. Ian clocks this swe moment. He keeps it inside, but he clearly notices their affection for each other. They notice Ian enter. Stevie stiffens up and gathers some courage.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (very nervously trying) Hey. Ian doesn’t acknowledge Stevie. This hurts Stevie. Ian quickly picks up his plate of food and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: (calls out to Ian) Do you want to eat in here?!  10. Ian walks into his bedroom and slams the door. Loud hip h music plays muffled through the door. SLOW PUSH IN ON THE DOOR VIBRATING. Back at the table Dabney looks upset. Stevie looks hurt. Stevie looks down at his food. He can’t figure out words say. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s just... (searching for words) So angry with me... (thinking out loud) I'm figuring all this out as I go. (a bit sad) I don’t know. Stevie feels uncomfortable hearing his mom say she doesn’ know what she’s doing. She clocks Stevie’s discomfort and lightens things up.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (where does the time go?) He turns eighteen this week. (beat. Cracks a smile) Benihana. Stevie almost smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (very dead pan) Should be a blast. They both let out a little laugh. Takes the pressure off. WIDE SHOT ON THEM EATING DINNER. INT. DABNEY’'S BEDROOM - LATER THAT NIGHT Dabney lays in bed in an oversized T-shirt with a blank expression watching the 0.J. SIMPSON TRIAL on television. Stevie sits on the floor at the foot of her bed watching her. INT. STEVIE’S BEDROOM - LATER A JERKY BOYS PRANK CALL plays on the Stevie’s stereo over scene. “Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles” figures and Micro Machine cars are strewn all over the floor and desk.  11. A “Street Fighter 2” poster, an “NBA JAM” poster, a Bo Jackson poster, and a “DuckTales” poster hang on the wall “Dinosaurs” plays on a tiny TV in the background on mute. Baby from “Dinosaurs” hits the Father dinosaur with a pan Stevie stands in front of his mirror in his underwear. He examines the bruises on his arms and chest from his fight with Ian this morning. He stares into the mirror. CLOSE U on the bruises. CLOSE UP on Stevie’s eyes taking them in. He’s not sad or even angry. They’re badges of honor. Like soldier’s war wounds. INT. STEVIE’S BEDROOM - LATER Stevie hears the front door open. He looks out the window see Ian getting in his car and driving away. He BOLTS out his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevie bursts into Ian’s room. He doesn’t know how much t he has. Ian’s room is an OCD wet dream. So clean and fill with a teenage obsessive collections. Ian's room is covered with east coast hip hop posters (Na O.C., Brand Nubian, Pete Rock and C.L. Smooth, Grand Puba Gang Starr, etc.) and tons and tons of CDs organized perfectly in alphabetical order. Stevie delicately inspects them like an archeologist insp a bone. He notices the names of the albums and rappers. H pulls a pen and piece of paper from his pocket and begins writing down some of the names of the rappers. Stevie brushes his hand gently over the racks of hip hop He carefully pulls one out like it’s a museum. He puts it his prized Discman. He sits Indian style on the floor wit his back to camera nodding his head to the music. He is enjoying hearing this music so much. Learning who Ian is. Learning about the world of hip hop. HOLD ON Stevie from behind nodding his head. After a long beat, Stevie hears a noise! He scrambles to the CD he is listening to back in its case. He runs out o Ian’s room and into his room. INT. STEVIE’S BEDROOM —- CONTINUOUS He breathes heavy, almost hyperventilating. He is safe, b still needs a minute to calm down.  12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevie approaches a FEMALE EMPLOYEE, 20, who is standing the “Hip Hop” CD aisle.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: How can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: I need to buy a birthday gift for someone.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: Okay. What’re you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: He has really, really good taste in music. In hip hop.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: (smiles) Okay. Stevie pulls out his list of rappers. She looks

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: He probably has all the good ones already. at the list and smiles at the cute-ness of it.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But if I could, like, get a really good one that he doesn’t have yet... that would be really cool. She looks up from the list. She has an idea. She pulls a off the rack and hands it to Stevie.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: Does he have this? It just came out two days ago. Stevie looks and it’s “LABCABINCALIFORNIA” by The Pharcyd Stevie’s eyes widen and he smiles while looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (so excited) He doesn’t have this. I didn’t see this one. He doesn’t have it. (serious but excited) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revision 13.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Like people who know a lot about hip hop would like this? And you're sure it’s like, really cool?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: (smiling) Yes, I’m sure.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (smiling) Thank you. WIDE SHOT of Stevie in line as he pulls out his chain wal and has barely enough money for the CD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevie gets caught at a red light on his bike. As he wait for the light to turn green, he sees TWO TEN-YEAR-OLDS st squirting each other with Nerf Super Soaker water guns. S MOTION ON THE KIDS as they are having the time of their lives. Laughing. These kids are only two years younger, b they seem in a different stage of life than Stevie. He is snapped out of his reflection by seeing the skate c from the day before, skate by as a crew weaving in and ou cars. This looks like the coolest thing he has ever seen. They seem like such badasses, but they are all interconne even though they aren’t verbally communicating. They fly Stevie, leaving him alone. EXT/INT. STEVIE’S GARAGE - LATE AFTERNOON Stevie rummages through the messy garage. He finds what h looking for! His brother’s warped, old 1980s body skatebo The body of the skateboard is bigger, bulkier and “neon”- than the boards he saw the crew from the bodega holding a skating on. The board has a giant, neon Dinosaur screamin “cowabunga” on it. It’s cheesy as hell but to Stevie it’s beautiful. He rolls the board back and forth under his foot a few ti The concrete outside his house is smooth. He puts his foot on the board and pushes on the board sloppily with his other foot. He rides on it for a few fe then jumps off. He does the same thing again. He does the same thing... SLAM! He falls on the grass. He’s shocked, but okay. The grass kept him from really hurting himself.  14.

dialogues.speaker: TRICKS.
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS of Stevie pushing and rolling on his board. Sometimes he jumps off and sometimes he falls off. Stevie carefully puts the board back exactly where it was the garage. INT. STEVIE’S BATHROOM - LATER Stevie looks at himself in the mirror as he practicing a monologue very meticulously and nervously like Luca Brasi the beginning of “The Godfather”.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (muttering to himself) Hey Ian. I’m so sorry to bother you... I saw your old skateboard in the garage. I notice that you never use it... Hi Ian. I was thinking that maybe there was a trade that could be made for something of mine that you... Oh hey Ian. I didn’t see you there. I know MY stuff sucks but... Hi Ian... Stevie breathes out nervously. He clenches his fist. He doesn’t want to blow this.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey Ian. Sorry to bother you... Stevie closes his eyes and takes a deep breath. INT. STEVIE’S BEDROOM - LATER LOW ANGLE SHOT FROM THE FLOOR UP TO STEVIE AND IAN. Ian a Stevie stare into camera for a long beat of silence. Stev looks incredibly nervous and is perspiring. Ian looks int into the camera, thinking hard. A SHOT OF THE SKATEBOARD FACE UP ON STEVIE’S FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: How much cash you got?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: I... I don’t have any...

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Why?  Revision 15.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: I spent it... on something...

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Fucking dumb fuck. (thinks ) I‘1l trade you for your Discman. Stevie’s face is confused and shocked. This is a massive Way bigger than he could have expected.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (very timid) Well. (beat/looking down) It’s just that... I use my Discman... all the time... or whatever... (beat/nervously looking down ) And mom got it for me for my birthday... and Christmas... or whatever...

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (sharply) I don’t need to do this. Ian bends down to grab the board.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Wait! Wait! Ian stands back up.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s the one thing in the world I can’t trade. I’m begging you. Anything else. Literally anything. Ian thinks about this. We see in Ian’s face he is going t completely fuck Stevie over on this deal.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (icy) You don’t even know about music, anyway. This hurts Stevie. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Revision 16.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE HANDS IAN 10 SUPER NINTENDO GAMES. ALL THE GOOD ON
dialogues.text: “STREET FIGHTER 2”, “F-ZERO” ETC. STEVIE’S FACE IS ELATED

dialogues.speaker: INTO.
dialogues.text: EXT. STEVIE’S HOUSE - A LITTLE LATER Stevie obsessively practices on his new board. He can gli pretty much every time without falling off. Over and over over again. EXT. STEVIE’S HOUSE - THAT EVENING Stevie, Dabney and Ian exit the house. Ian, Stevie and Da wear their “fancy clothes”. The boys in baggy polo shirts baggy khakis. Dabney in a dress. Stevie has the CD he bou for Ian, crudely wrapped in newspaper. There are two cars parked out front. Ian and Dabney walk towards their own c Stevie gathers up some courage and walks towards Ian’s ca

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (regarding the gift) I got you... He barely takes two steps towards Ian’s car as...

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (sharply grumbles) GO WITH MOM. Stevie JUMPS BACK like a scared puppy. Ian hustles to his and gets in. Stevie slowly shuffles towards Dabney’s car disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dabney, Ian and Stevie sit at a group table at Benihana w strangers filling out the rest of the table. A YOUNG WHIT COUPLE, 30, and AN AFRICAN AMERICAN MAN, 64, and his GRANDSON, 11. The BENIHANA CHEF is doing his thing on the grill. It is quiet amongst the three of them as they watc It’s an uncomfortable dinner. Stevie has the CD he bought the table with his hand on top of it.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: (to Ian) At my eighteenth birthday party I was breast feeding you.  17. The boys say nothing. It’s an uncomfortable image for all parties.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to herself almost) I was a baby who had a baby. Jesus, could you imagine if you had a baby right now? Dabney laughs to herself at how insane that seems and how insane it was at the time. Ian takes a deep breath. This subject matter strikes a deep nerve with him. Stevie is listening but more focused on the gift he has for Ian.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’re you gonna do with your friends tonight?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (rushed/quiet) chill. Beat. No other explanation.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: Sounds fun. The chef flips a shrimp tail into his shirt pocket. The couple and the Grandpa and Grandson smile and clap. Dabne Ian and Stevie sit in silence.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I got you a present. Dabney hands Ian a card in an envelope. He takes it. Rips open, doesn’t read the card, opens it, takes out the two twenty dollar bills and puts the money in his pocket and the card and trash on the table without ever reading the card. He looks back down at his plate. Dabney looks offen but not surprised.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (looking down/barely audible) Thanks. Deep breath from Dabney.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: (exasperated) You. Are. Welcome. Ian.  18. Beat. Stevie looks very nervous. He is gathering up the courage to give Ian his gift. His heart is racing. He tak deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: I... uhh... got this. Here. Stevie hands it to Ian. Stevie’s heart is RACING, he trie not to look to eager to see Ian’s reaction. Ian grabs the present and rips open the newspaper. He qui looks at the CD and with no expression puts the CD and th trash down on the table without looking at it again. With emotion or expression, Ian makes the slightest hint of a nod to Stevie in his direction. He shows no appreciation enjoyment of the gift. Stevie is CRUSHED. He swallows it the best he can, but th stings more than anything we’ve seen sting Stevie thus fa Beat.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (to Dabney/looking at his plate) How much longer is this?

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Until we’re done eating dinner.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: I want to leave.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: (pissed) Well we ordered and I’m paying for this food, so you’re staying.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (shaking his head/looking at plate) Whatever. The chef scoops chicken and shrimp onto Dabney’s plate. S forces a smile to the chef then back to Ian.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: (to chef) Thank you. (to Ian/muted yell) What is wrong with you? Ian says nothing and just stares at his plate.  19.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why do you make it so difficult to be around you? Ian still looks at his plate.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (aggressive to Dabney) Shut the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: What did you just say to me?!

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: I said: “Shut. The Fuck. Up.” The African American Grandfather uncomfortably tries to t louder to his Grandson so he doesn’t hear this argument.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: (losing it) Just leave if this is so fucking miserable for you! You think we want to be here?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (serious and scary) You're a fucking BITCH! Ian darts up and leaves the table. Dabney flinches with a of anger and fear. She puts her face in her hands and let emotional grunt into her hands. Ian leaves the CD on the table. Stevie looks shattered. He just stares at the CD. to die. It is very unpleasant and uncomfortable with the other pe at the table and with the Chef.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: (to the other patrons) Sorry. Dabney starts crying in her hands. Stevie consoles Dabney rubbing her back. HOLD ON A CLOSE UP OF STEVIE HOLDING BACK HIS OWN TEARS. WIDE SHOT of the uncomfortable table at Benihana with the strangers. Stevie is crushed. Everyone else in the restau is having fun.  20. HOLD ON CLOSE UP OF THE CD FOR A LONG BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMERA LEADS STEVIE AS HE SKATES ACROSS THE STREET.
dialogues.text: His face is determined and displays a nervous hardness. C pass as he dodges them, he stops short, lets them pass Th honk at him and then he keeps pushing. He gets to the other side of the street outside the shop. picks up his board and walks up the curb. He reaches the front door of the shop. He puts his hand on the handle. H takes a deep breath. He enters the shop. INT. ULTIMATE SKATE SHOP —- CONTINUOUS Stevie quietly enters the shop for the first time, trying be as stealth as possible. The door opens loudly. Stevie looks overwhelmed. We feel the energy of all the skaters we saw in the bodega filling the store, but we on see pieces of them sitting down in a couch area in the ba We hear them yelling, talking shit and laughing with each other. They are blocked by various clothing racks. Stevie walks through the store as quietly and incognito a possible. He sees a giant wall lined with SKATE DECKS (Girl, Chocol Flip, Hook Ups, Alien Workshop, World Industries, Plan B, Blind etc.). He notices how subversive the artwork is on the skate decks. He keeps walking. He sees another wall l with SKATE SHOES. On another side, he sees glass encaseme filled with SKATE TRUCKS, SKATE WHEELS and SKATE STICKERS He’s puzzled and not sure how all the pieces fit together walks through RACKS of T-SHIRTS and HOODIES that fill the middle section of the store. The voices of the crew grow louder as Stevie gets closer. Through the T-shirts we see Ruben, Fourth Grade, and Jorg sitting on couches and the floor surrounding a television The crew is watching a skate video and talking shit to ea other. Behind the couches is a work area, where boards are set u Fuckshit is behind the work area setting up a board for a YOUNG CUSTOMER. Stevie looks at all the cool boards on the walls. Examine all the trucks and wheels in the glass cases.  21. Walks back over to the T-shirts and pretends to look at t but really is looking at the crew hanging out. No one eve looks in his direction or asks him if he needs help with something. Stevie watches.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: A baseball hat is held by a hand as money is stuffed insi by various hands. WE WIDEN OUT to reveal Fourth Grade hol the hat.

dialogues.speaker: FOURTH GRADE
dialogues.text: Ante up. Everyone pitches in for tape so I can film.

dialogues.speaker: FUCKSHIT
dialogues.text: I just kicked in, nigga.

dialogues.speaker: JORGE
dialogues.text: That was a week ago. And without footie, no one’s going pro around here, son. Greater good, yo. Fuckshit nods his head understanding. He pulls out a coup bills and tosses them in Fourth Grade’s hat. They all go to watching Plan B’s “Virtual Reality” skate video on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: FUCKSHIT
dialogues.text: (fantasy mode) Okay, if you could go pro for one team, who would it be? The whole crew gets excited at this day dream.

dialogues.speaker: JORGE
dialogues.text: Easy. Girl or Chocolate or Menace. Easy.

dialogues.speaker: FUCKSHIT
dialogues.text: Chocolate or Menace for sure.

dialogues.speaker: JORGE
dialogues.text: Fuck. Chocolate, yeah, that’s the one. Imagine you and me decked out in all Chocolate gear. Free gear they just send us on the regular. We'd have the whole crew decked out in all Chocolate gear. Fuckshit and Jorge smile. They’ve had this day dream befo  22.

dialogues.speaker: JORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I already know what the first graphic on my board would be: A sick illustration with me wrapped in the Mexican flag manualing the stage at the courthouse.

dialogues.speaker: FUCKSHIT
dialogues.text: (super into it) So sick, nigga. So sick. He and Jorge give a hand shake.

dialogues.speaker: FUCKSHIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know what my first board graphic would be. The Tribe Called Quest album cover with all the rappers heads on it, but it would be our whole crew's heads on it.

dialogues.speaker: THE CREW
dialogues.text: That’s tight!/So Dope!

dialogues.speaker: JORGE
dialogues.text: That would be so sick, yo. We'd never have to buy boards again. Free boards forever.

dialogues.speaker: JORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whatever team we end up on. It’s us together. Fuckshit gives Jorge another excited hand shake.

dialogues.speaker: FUCKSHIT
dialogues.text: (joyously) That's what’s up, nigga. That’s what’s up. The crew sits happily and thinks about this day dream.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: Stevie is at a closer rack of clothes pretending to brows but is secretly watching the crew watch videos and talk s There are a few other DIFFERENT RANDOM SKATER KIDS are browsing and hanging out in the store. A classic intro to WU TANG CLAN song blasts on the stereo. SUPER CLOSE UP ON FUCKSHIT’S FACE AS HE PERFECTLY RAPS TH INTRO TO THE SONG. When the beat kicks in we WIDEN OUT. Fuckshit is standing rapping every word perfectly.  23. He is jumping up and down getting everyone hyped up. The is into it and laughing and playfully punching him. Stevi smiling and laughing at this infectious joyous energy.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: Stevie is waiting by the glass case in front of the store with the stickers in them. He admires all of the amazing stickers. He sees a copy of Thrasher and Big Brother maga on the counter. He flips through them delicately. Ruben finally approaches Stevie.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: Yo. Stevie is pretty stunned anyone in here has acknowledged let alone talked to him.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Uhh... hey. Uncomfortable silence.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: Do you need something?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Oh. Uhh... can I have this sticker? Stevie thoughtfully and carefully points.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And that one, please? Ruben slides open the glass, grabs them and tosses them o the glass towards Stevie.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: Two bucks. Stevie takes out his chain wallet and takes two bucks out

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What grade are you in?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Seventh.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: Me too. Where do you go to school?  24.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Palms. (nervous ) You?

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: Crenshaw. DING! Fuckshit walks into the store with a Subway Sandwic a clear Subway plastic bag. He walks by Stevie and sees t board he’s holding.

dialogues.speaker: FUCKSHIT
dialogues.text: (very dry/subtly sarcastic) Cool board.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (not getting the sarcasm) Thanks! Fuckshit has already kept walking. Ruben smiles about the interaction.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: Atight.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Cool. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: Later. Stevie leaves the store. Once he is outside he has a HUGE beaming smile. They acknowledged him. EXT. MAGAZINE STAND —- LATE AFTERNOON Stevie skates up to the magazine stand. He scans the rack through the fitness mags, beauty mags, and on the bottom right finally finds the skate magazines. He grabs a copy Thrasher, Slap and Big Brother. He pays the guy and skate off. EXT. STEVIE’S HOUSE - THAT NIGHT Stevie practices skating obsessively. Quick cuts of him riding back and fourth on the sidewalk. Turning, zigzaggi etc. He is sweating. It’s getting later and later into th night. Dabney finally calls him in from the front door.  25.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: Stevie! It’s late! Come on! Stevie picks up his board and runs inside. INT. STEVIE’S BEDROOM - THAT NIGHT QUICK CUTS of Stevie taking down Ninja Turtle and NBA JAM posters and putting up his two stickers and tear-outs fro his skate magazines with scotch tape. His room is now thr quarters kid posters and one wall is all skating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DING! Stevie enters the store. Unlike last time the store quiet and empty. He wanders towards the back, but no one there. As he gets towards the very back he hears noise co from outside the back door. He follows the sounds. The back door, which is half open, leads to a parking lot Partially obscured by the door, we see the crew skating. Stevie creeps outside with his board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevie watches the kids skate. They’re attempting and lan some cool tricks as music plays from a ghetto blaster. Stevie sits on the ground with his back against the wall his board flipped up next to him. He continues to watch t tricks and commit them to memory. He spins the wheel of h board with his hand while watching. Jorge walks by and notices Stevie’s board.

dialogues.speaker: JORGE
dialogues.text: (dry/sarcastic) Nice board, yo.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (elated/unaware of the sarcasm) Thanks! Jorge smiles, shakes his head and skates off. Ruben attem a kickflip and lands it with one foot as Stevie watches.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: Fuck!  26. Ruben skates over next to Stevie, but doesn’t notice him. Stevie is subtly trying to make eye contact with the only person he’s broken ground with within the crew. Ruben pic up the bottom of his T-shirt and wipes the sweat from his eyes with it. He picks up a gallon of water from the grou and starts chugging. Late in his chug he notices Stevie sitting there. He takes the gallon away from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Stevie) Oh, what’s up fool? Stevie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Skating like shit today, man.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (unsure what to say) Looks cool to me.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: (a compliment is a compliment ) I’m Ruben.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Stevie. They give a “teenager new acquaintance lazy hand shake”. Ruben clocks Stevie’s wack 80s board. He wants to say something but he decides not to embarrass him. He just ki of smiles and shakes his head. Jorge skates over to them picks up the jug of water which is now empty.

dialogues.speaker: JORGE
dialogues.text: (to Ruben re: empty jug) Will you go fill this up, yo? Ruben instinctively goes to refill it. He thinks of somet and stops in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: (to Stevie/in front of Jorge) Yo Stevie, go fill up this jug with water?  27.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (with excitement) For sure! Stevie’s eyes light up. He is excited to be given a task Ruben and in some way help or be involved with the skatin He runs off with the jug with enthusiasm. INT. ULTIMATE STORE BATHROOM —- CONTINUOUS Stevie is filling up the jug with water at the sink. He i smiling wide. Happy to be a part of this at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevie practices the cool tricks he saw the crew doing in back parking lot by himself. QUICK FLASHES of the crew members doing their tricks intercut with Stevie’s awful misguided attempts. He slams and falls constantly trying these tricks. He can take it. He gets up. Scrapes and all

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevie watches them skate and gathers up his courage. He takes a few deep breaths. Stevie puts the board under his left foot and rolls it ba and forth under his foot a couple times. There is somethi really rough and intense about this. Stevie puts his left foot on the board and kicks a couple times, pushing him into the middle of the parking lot in view of the crew. The crew watches him like a new young c in the animal kingdom. He GETS ON THE BOARD and coasts for a couple of feet. He does his pathetic attempt at an ollie... SLAM! Stevie CRA INTO THE CONCRETE. He is in a lot of pain and shock. We a CLOSE on his face and the gravel underneath it. The crew ERUPTS into laughter, mocking the shit out of Stevie. We stay CLOSE on Stevie. He all of the sudden LEA up to his feet. The pain of falling didn’t phase him AT A Ruben is watching. A bit worried and embarrassed for Stev QUICK CUT CLOSE UP OF STEVIE GRABBING HIS BOARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevie pushes a couple of times and starts gliding again. is gliding for a few moments with determination on his fa and he busts another ugly attempt at an ollie and... SLAM CLOSE again on his face and the gravel underneath it. His face isn’t shocked this time. He’s okay. The crew laughs even harder this time. Stevie LEAPS UP and brushes off some dirt. He is filthy. makes eye contact with Ruben. Ruben’s expression is “what fuck are you doing?” Stevie’s not bailing. Stevie sees Fourth Grade is filming him now and the crew laughing at him. QUICK CUT CLOSE UP OF STEVIE GRABBING HIS BOARD.

dialogues.speaker: COUPLE OF TIMES.
dialogues.text: Stevie pushes a couple of times and starts gliding again. glides for a few moments, determination on his face. He b another awkward attempt at an ollie...and SLAMS EVEN HARD It took the wind out of him but won’t let it stop him. CLOSE again on his face and the gravel underneath it. Ste could not give a fuck about the pain. He won’t fucking st He LEAPS UP again. The sees the crew’s faces changing to subtly from laughin him to slightly impressed with how hard of slams he’s tak and picking himself back up again. Big balls. QUICK CUT CLOSE UP OF STEVIE GRABBING HIS BOARD.

dialogues.speaker: COUPLE OF TIMES.
dialogues.text: A hand grabs him by the shirt off the board. It’s Ruben’s hand. He picks up Stevie’s board and walks Stevie into th store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruben is walking fast and Stevie is following him through store.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: Come here.  29. Ruben walks him out of the store to the front of the stor where no one is skating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruben and Stevie stand out front of the shop with their boards.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: (in shock) Are you fucking crazy, yo?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (worried) Did I do something wrong? Ruben thinks.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: DUDE. That was embarrassing as shit for you, yo!

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (beating himself up) Oh. Damn.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: And do you, like, not feel pain or something?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: You slammed fucking hard a TON of times and it didn’t even phase you for a second? Stevie thinks for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (genuine to Ruben) I just really want to get better. Ruben takes this in. Shakes his head. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: You're fucking crazy, yo. (thinks ) I think what you’re trying to do, I can’t tell because that looked fucking insane to me, is an ollie.  30.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: It basically is what it’s called when you jump off the ground with your board. You can’t do any fucking tricks if you can’t ollie, yo. Ruben thinks for a moment and then picks up Stevie’s boar and places Stevie’s back wheels of his board in the crack the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get on the board. Stevie gets on the board silently.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The wheels are in the crack so you won’t roll away and you can do this shit over and over. Like a billion times in a row. Because it’s gonna take that many before you can do it. Just keep doing it. Stevie nods his head. Ruben places his board parallel to Stevie and steps on it so Stevie can watch him.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When you pop back on your tail, you're going to slide your front foot to the front as you jump so you pop up into the air and the board stays with you. Ruben does a perfect ollie. The board looks as if it’s st to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You go. Stevie does the lamest looking attempt at an ollie you’ve ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Damn, son. That was the ugliest shit I’ve ever seen in my life. Eww. Come chill for a minute. You're gonna have a fucking heart attack.  31. Stevie sits next to Ruben. He’s sweaty and out of breath. Ruben pulls out a pack of Camel Lights and a lighter. Ste is NOT used to being around people his age smoking cigare and we see it on his face. It’s quiet except for cars pas by. Ruben lights his cigarette. He offers one to Stevie.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here. Stevie looks fucking terrified as HELL but he doesn’t wan be seen as lame for not taking one. HE nervously takes a cigarette out of Ruben’s pack. Ruben hands him the lighte He very awkwardly lights his first cigarette. He puffs it awkwardly without inhaling, trying his best not to cough. looks VERY unnatural. Ruben chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (chuckling) You don’t smoke do you?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (debating on whether to lie) Uh. I mean... not like... a lot. Ruben looks at him like “come on dude”.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Very casually. Stevie takes another awkward puff. He tries not to cough. Smoke gets in his eyes and it’s uncomfortable. Ruben laug

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: You’re funny, yo. Stevie takes a break from his cigarette and rests it on t edge of the bench.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: So, how long have you skated for?

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: (thinks ) Since last year... (squinting/thinking) Maybe like eight months?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (so interested) You love it?  32.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s cool. (thinking) Yeah, I do. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (sincere) Thanks for teaching me that.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: (confused/upset ) What’re you gay?

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: (what the FUCK) Why the fuck are you... THANKING me and shit? Stevie is freaked out and confused.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (terrified) You think I’m gay because I thanked you for helping me?

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Don’t fuckin’... THANK people, man. That’s gay as hell, yo.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (genuine) I’m sorry. I didn’t know that.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: (smoking/calming down) It’s fine. Now you know. It’s a little uncomfortably silent.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (shaking his head/under his breath) Fuckin’ weirdo. Silence. Stevie is worried he’s blown everything.  33.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (gotta get something off my chest) Can I tell you something?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sure.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: You gotta get a new fucking board, dude.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (surprised) Really?

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: YES. That shit is eighties as fuck and has a wack ass neon Velociraptor on it screaming “cowabunga”. You look retarded, yo.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (maybe you're off on this one) Are you sure? Everyone keeps complimenting me on it.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: They're fucking with you, Stevie. Stevie realizes and is hurt.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (sad) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: (it’s okay) It's fine. Everyone here fucks with each other non-fucking stop. You just gotta get a new board fucking fast, yo.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Okay, I will. For sure. How much are they?

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: Hundred twenty for a complete.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (shocked) I don’t have that kind of money.  34.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: I’1l sell you my used setup for 40 bucks. Stevie thinks this over. He may be able to swing that.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Don’t you need your board?

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: (smiles) I’m saving up for an “Ultimate” board.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (so curious) What’s an “Ultimate” board?

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: (super proud) It’s the shop team’s board. You have to be ALLOWED to buy one. You can’t just walk in off the street and buy one. (now bragging) I just got the okay from the crew, so now once I get the money, I can get an Ultimate board. All Stevie wants in this universe is to be allowed to buy Ultimate board one day.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So I'll sell you mine for forty bucks which is a dope ass price.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Than.... Stevie is about to speak, but stops himself. Reconsiders.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was about to thank you, but I know now how gay that is.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: (what the fuck) You don’t have to say that shit either. Just fuckin’ say nothing, yo. Jesus Fucking Christ. Stevie smiles.  35.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (smiling) Sorry. Ruben chuckles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: You're fuckin’ funny, yo. Weird as hell but funny. They both laugh a little. Stevie realizes something.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know, probably like eight?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (super nervous) Oh man. I... I gotta go, man. Stevie gets up.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: Aight, man. Stevie gathers himself and his board.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: You don’t have to be home at a certain time? Ruben looks down for a beat. He stares down.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: (brushing it off) Nah. It’s better for me if I get home after my mom is asleep. Uncomfortable heavy silence.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (picks up on the trouble at home but doesn’t know what to say) Oh. Beat. Ruben looks up finally.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow? Stevie lights up! Ruben just invited him back to the shop  36.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (smiling like an idiot) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: A'ight. Ruben reaches out for the “lazy new homie handshake”. Ste skates off smiling from ear to fucking ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevie bursts into the gas station bathroom with his boar He immediately, and in a mad rush, heads over to the sink starts pumping excessive amounts of soap all over his arm hands, face and scrubbing it off with water. He smells hi breath and can tell it smells like smoke. He’s panicked. literally begins to wash his mouth out with soap aggressively. He continues pumping soap, lathering and washing out the soap from his mouth manically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevie is skating home as fast as he can. All of the sudd it starts pouring rain. He keeps skating even though it’s slippery and new to him. He has to get home. INT. STEVIE’S HOUSE - FRONT ENTRANCE - MINUTES LATER We hear the keys jangling outside and the lock open. Stev BURSTS through the front door. Dabney rushes from the kit to greet him.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: Stevie? (then) You're soaking!

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, I lost track of time, I’m so sorry it won’t happen again. Sorry. Dabney is confused.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: It’s only seven thirty.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (sigh of relief) Oh. Great.  37. Dabney is puzzled and amused. Stevie is worried she will smell smoke. He takes off to his room.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (running) I’m gonna put on dry clothes. INT. STEVIE’S BEDROOM —- CONTINUOUS Stevie bursts through the door and slams it shut behind h He takes off his shirt and dries himself off with it. He looks at his board and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (to himself) So lame. He looks out the window and it’s pouring. He looks back a his board. He wants to skate more, but it’s pouring. He p his board on the carpet and stands on it. He practices so ollies on the carpet. He doesn’t notice how loud the soun inside the house. He does a few more. Dabney BURSTS through Stevie’s door! It scares the shit o of him. She is scared also.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: What is that noise?! Are you okay?! She sees it’s the skateboard. She laughs a bit.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’re you doing, kid?

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Practicing. She laughs. It’s cute. She throws herself on his bed on h stomach with her head at the foot of the bed facing Stevi It’s an invasion of Stevie’s space. He is annoyed by it b swallows it. He sits in his desk chair.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: (relieved/laughing) You scared the shit out of me.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Sorry. I would have practiced outside but it’s pouring. She thinks for a moment.  38.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: You love this skateboarding, huh? Stevie looks at her sincerely.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (half smiling) Yeah. (then) Actually, there’s something I wanted to talk to you about.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY
dialogues.text: Always.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: (deep breath) I wanted to... ask you... for money for a new board.

dialogues.speaker: DABNEY

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN
dialogues.text: (the absolute truth) No, I am. SHOT FROM BEHIND of the two boys sitting in silence. INT. STEVIE’S HOSPITAL ROOM - MINUTES LATER We enter mid, well not conversation, more like extremely awkward silence between Fourth Grade and Stevie. They’ve probably never spoken before. They uncomfortably do their equivalents of twiddling their thumbs in the uncomfortabl silence. Fourth Grade sits in the chair next to Stevie’s hospital bed.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: So... Uncomfortable beat of silence.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, Fourth Grade, I really don’t know you that well.  115. Stevie smiles realizing the truth. Fourth Grade takes thi and thinks deeply about it. After a long beat of thinking looks at Stevie in the eyes and gives a thoughtful respon

dialogues.speaker: FOURTH GRADE
dialogues.text: (very sincere) Yeah... but... I’m still there. Stevie takes this in. There is a beat of silence but it’s awkward as much as it’s cathartic. Another beat. FOURTH GRADE (CONT’D) Don’t tell anyone I showed you this. But since you’re all fucked up, I’1l show it to you. Fourth Grade gets up and pulls some cables out of his poc He is holding his camcorder and begins putting the plugs the hospital TV and the camcorder and messing with the AU settings. It’s ready. FOURTH GRADE (CONT’D) It’s something I’ve been working on. You’re awesome in it. Fourth Grade hits play and as he walks out of the room he lovingly squeezes Stevie’s shoulder. He leaves. DEAD CENTER SHOT on Stevie watching the television from h hospital bed as we hear music and skate sounds from the c off the camcorder. We stay DEAD CENTER on Stevie as the camera SLOWLY MOVES CLOSER And CLOSER TO STEVIE. The camera SLOWLY MOVES CLOS AND CLOSER TO STEVIE’S FACE AS HE WATCHES. His face is expressionless but he takes a couple deep breaths, experiencing emotions while watching this. The camera SLOWLY MOVES CLOSER AND CLOSER to his face unt we ARE LOCKED ON HIS EYES. The same shot that opened the movie. WE HOLD ON HIS EYES. His eyes very, very minimally glass up. HOLD ON STEVIE’S EYES FOR A LONG BEAT. We hear sounds of the crew laughing and skating. We hear a KNOCK at the door. Stevie turns the T.V. Off wi the remote. Stevie looks over his shoulder to see Ian standing at the doorway. Ian nods towards the chair.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Can...

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Revision 116. Ian sits in the chair next to Stevie’s bed in the heavies silence we've felt so far since we’ve met Stevie. This silence feels like it’s lasting forever.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (the hardest question he’s ever asked) Why don’t you want to be my brother? This shreds Ian like a blade. Ian looks off to the farthe corner of the room with his eyes to avoid Stevie’s eyes. takes a deep, staggered breath. Long beat.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (the hardest sentence he’s ever said) It’s not you. (beat) I'm fucked up, Stevie. Ian keeps his eyes focused at the furthest corner of the away from Stevie’s eyes. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: STEVIE
dialogues.text: There’s no one I like more than you. Beat. Ian’s eyes don’t well up with tears, but if they co they would. Ian doesn’t say anything. He just gets up and begins to l the room while looking down the whole time. He stops by Stevie’s bed.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (his eyes are welled up/so quietly) Your friends seem nice. Stevie’s eyes can’t help but water up but he rapidly wipe them away. Ian looks into his jacket pocket, and reaches in. He pull out the half bottle of Drakkar Noir cologne from the open and gently places it next to Stevie’s torso on his hospit bed. He makes eye contact with Stevie for the first time a split second and exits the room. Stevie is alone. He examines the bottle of cologne and just the corner of his mouth wrinkles into a fragment of a smile. He stares at t cologne. CUT TO BLACK.
